DESCRIPTION.P: This block allows user to save data in a file, in formatted and binary mode. Each call to the block corresponds to a record in the file. Each record has the following form: [t,V1,...,Vn] where t is the value of time when block is called and Vi is the ith input value

ITEMIZE.label: DIALOGUE PARAMETERS
ITEMIZE.ITEM: : a scalar. This fixes the input size
: a character string defining the path of the file

: a character string defining the Fortran format to use or nothing for an unformatted (binary) write. If given, the format must began by a left parenthesis and end by a right parenthesis. example: (e10.3).
: To improve efficiency it is possible to buffer the input data. write on the file is only done after each Buffer size calls to the block.
